lines.value: DUKE ORSINO
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: If music be the food of love, play on;
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: Give me excess of it, that, surfeiting,
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: The appetite may sicken, and so die.
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: That strain again! it had a dying fall:
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: O, it came o'er my ear like the sweet sound,
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: That breathes upon a bank of violets,
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: Stealing and giving odour! Enough; no more:
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: 'Tis not so sweet now as it was before.
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: O spirit of love! how quick and fresh art thou,
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: That, notwithstanding thy capacity
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: Receiveth as the sea, nought enters there,
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: Of what validity and pitch soe'er,
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: But falls into abatement and low price,
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: Even in a minute: so full of shapes is fancy
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: That it alone is high fantastical.
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: CURIO
lines.speaker: CURIO

lines.value: Will you go hunt, my lord?
lines.speaker: CURIO

lines.value: DUKE ORSINO
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: What, Curio?
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: CURIO
lines.speaker: CURIO

lines.value: The hart.
lines.speaker: CURIO

lines.value: DUKE ORSINO
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: Why, so I do, the noblest that I have:
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: O, when mine eyes did see Olivia first,
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: Methought she purged the air of pestilence!
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: That instant was I turn'd into a hart;
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: And my desires, like fell and cruel hounds,
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: E'er since pursue me.
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: How now! what news from her?
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: VALENTINE
lines.speaker: VALENTINE

lines.value: So please my lord, I might not be admitted;
lines.speaker: VALENTINE

lines.value: But from her handmaid do return this answer:
lines.speaker: VALENTINE

lines.value: The element itself, till seven years' heat,
lines.speaker: VALENTINE

lines.value: Shall not behold her face at ample view;
lines.speaker: VALENTINE

lines.value: But, like a cloistress, she will veiled walk
lines.speaker: VALENTINE

lines.value: And water once a day her chamber round
lines.speaker: VALENTINE

lines.value: With eye-offending brine: all this to season
lines.speaker: VALENTINE

lines.value: A brother's dead love, which she would keep fresh
lines.speaker: VALENTINE

lines.value: And lasting in her sad remembrance.
lines.speaker: VALENTINE

lines.value: DUKE ORSINO
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: O, she that hath a heart of that fine frame
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: To pay this debt of love but to a brother,
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: How will she love, when the rich golden shaft
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: Hath kill'd the flock of all affections else
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: That live in her; when liver, brain and heart,
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: These sovereign thrones, are all supplied, and fill'd
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: Her sweet perfections with one self king!
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: Away before me to sweet beds of flowers:
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: Love-thoughts lie rich when canopied with bowers.
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: VIOLA
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: What country, friends, is this?
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: Captain
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: This is Illyria, lady.
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: VIOLA
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: And what should I do in Illyria?
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: My brother he is in Elysium.
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: Perchance he is not drown'd: what think you, sailors?
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: Captain
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: It is perchance that you yourself were saved.
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: VIOLA
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: O my poor brother! and so perchance may he be.
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: Captain
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: True, madam: and, to comfort you with chance,
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: Assure yourself, after our ship did split,
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: When you and those poor number saved with you
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: Hung on our driving boat, I saw your brother,
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: Most provident in peril, bind himself,
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: Courage and hope both teaching him the practise,
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: To a strong mast that lived upon the sea;
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: Where, like Arion on the dolphin's back,
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: I saw him hold acquaintance with the waves
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: So long as I could see.
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: VIOLA
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: For saying so, there's gold:
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: Mine own escape unfoldeth to my hope,
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: Whereto thy speech serves for authority,
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: The like of him. Know'st thou this country?
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: Captain
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: Ay, madam, well; for I was bred and born
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: Not three hours' travel from this very place.
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: VIOLA
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: Who governs here?
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: Captain
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: A noble duke, in nature as in name.
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: VIOLA
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: What is the name?
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: Captain
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: Orsino.
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: VIOLA
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: Orsino! I have heard my father name him:
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: He was a bachelor then.
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: Captain
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: And so is now, or was so very late;
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: For but a month ago I went from hence,
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: And then 'twas fresh in murmur,--as, you know,
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: What great ones do the less will prattle of,--
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: That he did seek the love of fair Olivia.
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: VIOLA
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: What's she?
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: Captain
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: A virtuous maid, the daughter of a count
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: That died some twelvemonth since, then leaving her
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: In the protection of his son, her brother,
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: Who shortly also died: for whose dear love,
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: They say, she hath abjured the company
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: And sight of men.
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: VIOLA
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: O that I served that lady
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: And might not be delivered to the world,
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: Till I had made mine own occasion mellow,
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: What my estate is!
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: Captain
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: That were hard to compass;
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: Because she will admit no kind of suit,
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: No, not the duke's.
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: VIOLA
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: There is a fair behavior in thee, captain;
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: And though that nature with a beauteous wall
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: Doth oft close in pollution, yet of thee
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: I will believe thou hast a mind that suits
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: With this thy fair and outward character.
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: I prithee, and I'll pay thee bounteously,
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: Conceal me what I am, and be my aid
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: For such disguise as haply shall become
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: The form of my intent. I'll serve this duke:
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: Thou shall present me as an eunuch to him:
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: It may be worth thy pains; for I can sing
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: And speak to him in many sorts of music
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: That will allow me very worth his service.
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: What else may hap to time I will commit;
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: Only shape thou thy silence to my wit.
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: Captain
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: Be you his eunuch, and your mute I'll be:
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: When my tongue blabs, then let mine eyes not see.
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: VIOLA
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: I thank thee: lead me on.
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: SIR TOBY BELCH
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: What a plague means my niece, to take the death of
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: her brother thus? I am sure care's an enemy to life.
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: MARIA
lines.speaker: MARIA

lines.value: By my troth, Sir Toby, you must come in earlier o'
lines.speaker: MARIA

lines.value: nights: your cousin, my lady, takes great
lines.speaker: MARIA

lines.value: exceptions to your ill hours.
lines.speaker: MARIA

lines.value: SIR TOBY BELCH
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: Why, let her except, before excepted.
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: MARIA
lines.speaker: MARIA

lines.value: Ay, but you must confine yourself within the modest
lines.speaker: MARIA

lines.value: limits of order.
lines.speaker: MARIA

lines.value: SIR TOBY BELCH
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: Confine! I'll confine myself no finer than I am:
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: these clothes are good enough to drink in; and so be
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: these boots too: an they be not, let them hang
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: themselves in their own straps.
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: MARIA
lines.speaker: MARIA

lines.value: That quaffing and drinking will undo you: I heard
lines.speaker: MARIA

lines.value: my lady talk of it yesterday; and of a foolish
lines.speaker: MARIA

lines.value: knight that you brought in one night here to be her wooer.
lines.speaker: MARIA

lines.value: SIR TOBY BELCH
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: Who, Sir Andrew Aguecheek?
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: MARIA
lines.speaker: MARIA

lines.value: Ay, he.
lines.speaker: MARIA

lines.value: SIR TOBY BELCH
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: He's as tall a man as any's in Illyria.
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: MARIA
lines.speaker: MARIA

lines.value: What's that to the purpose?
lines.speaker: MARIA

lines.value: SIR TOBY BELCH
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: Why, he has three thousand ducats a year.
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: MARIA
lines.speaker: MARIA

lines.value: Ay, but he'll have but a year in all these ducats:
lines.speaker: MARIA

lines.value: he's a very fool and a prodigal.
lines.speaker: MARIA

lines.value: SIR TOBY BELCH
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: Fie, that you'll say so! he plays o' the
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: viol-de-gamboys, and speaks three or four languages
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: word for word without book, and hath all the good
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: gifts of nature.
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: MARIA
lines.speaker: MARIA

lines.value: He hath indeed, almost natural: for besides that
lines.speaker: MARIA

lines.value: he's a fool, he's a great quarreller: and but that
lines.speaker: MARIA

lines.value: he hath the gift of a coward to allay the gust he
lines.speaker: MARIA

lines.value: hath in quarrelling, 'tis thought among the prudent
lines.speaker: MARIA

lines.value: he would quickly have the gift of a grave.
lines.speaker: MARIA

lines.value: SIR TOBY BELCH
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: By this hand, they are scoundrels and subtractors
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: that say so of him. Who are they?
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: MARIA
lines.speaker: MARIA

lines.value: They that add, moreover, he's drunk nightly in your company.
lines.speaker: MARIA

lines.value: SIR TOBY BELCH
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: With drinking healths to my niece: I'll drink to
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: her as long as there is a passage in my throat and
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: drink in Illyria: he's a coward and a coystrill
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: that will not drink to my niece till his brains turn
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: o' the toe like a parish-top. What, wench!
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: Castiliano vulgo! for here comes Sir Andrew Agueface.
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.speaker: SIR ANDREW

lines.value: SIR TOBY BELCH
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: Sweet Sir Andrew!
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: SIR ANDREW
lines.speaker: SIR ANDREW

lines.value: Bless you, fair shrew.
lines.speaker: SIR ANDREW

lines.value: MARIA
lines.speaker: MARIA

lines.value: And you too, sir.
lines.speaker: MARIA

lines.value: SIR TOBY BELCH
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: Accost, Sir Andrew, accost.

lines.speaker: SIR ANDREW

lines.value: What's that?
lines.speaker: SIR ANDREW

lines.value: SIR TOBY BELCH
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: My niece's chambermaid.
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: SIR ANDREW
lines.speaker: SIR ANDREW

lines.value: Good Mistress Accost, I desire better acquaintance.
lines.speaker: SIR ANDREW

lines.value: MARIA
lines.speaker: MARIA

lines.value: My name is Mary, sir.
lines.speaker: MARIA

lines.value: SIR ANDREW
lines.speaker: SIR ANDREW

lines.value: Good Mistress Mary Accost,--

lines.value: SIR TOBY BELCH
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: You mistake, knight; 'accost' is front her, board
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: her, woo her, assail her.
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: SIR ANDREW
lines.speaker: SIR ANDREW

lines.value: By my troth, I would not undertake her in this
lines.speaker: SIR ANDREW

lines.value: company. Is that the meaning of 'accost'?
lines.speaker: SIR ANDREW

lines.value: MARIA
lines.speaker: MARIA

lines.value: Fare you well, gentlemen.
lines.speaker: MARIA

lines.value: SIR TOBY BELCH
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: An thou let part so, Sir Andrew, would thou mightst
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: never draw sword again.
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: SIR ANDREW
lines.speaker: SIR ANDREW

lines.value: An you part so, mistress, I would I might never
lines.speaker: SIR ANDREW

lines.value: draw sword again. Fair lady, do you think you have
lines.speaker: SIR ANDREW

lines.value: fools in hand?
lines.speaker: SIR ANDREW

lines.value: MARIA
lines.speaker: MARIA

lines.value: Sir, I have not you by the hand.
lines.speaker: MARIA

lines.value: SIR ANDREW
lines.speaker: SIR ANDREW

lines.value: Marry, but you shall have; and here's my hand.
lines.speaker: SIR ANDREW

lines.value: MARIA
lines.speaker: MARIA

lines.value: Now, sir, 'thought is free:' I pray you, bring
lines.speaker: MARIA

lines.value: your hand to the buttery-bar and let it drink.
lines.speaker: MARIA

lines.value: SIR ANDREW
lines.speaker: SIR ANDREW

lines.value: Wherefore, sweet-heart? what's your metaphor?
lines.speaker: SIR ANDREW

lines.value: MARIA
lines.speaker: MARIA

lines.value: It's dry, sir.
lines.speaker: MARIA

lines.value: SIR ANDREW
lines.speaker: SIR ANDREW

lines.value: Why, I think so: I am not such an ass but I can
lines.speaker: SIR ANDREW

lines.value: keep my hand dry. But what's your jest?
lines.speaker: SIR ANDREW

lines.value: MARIA
lines.speaker: MARIA

lines.value: A dry jest, sir.
lines.speaker: MARIA

lines.value: SIR ANDREW
lines.speaker: SIR ANDREW

lines.value: Are you full of them?
lines.speaker: SIR ANDREW

lines.value: MARIA
lines.speaker: MARIA

lines.value: Ay, sir, I have them at my fingers' ends: marry,

lines.value: now I let go your hand, I am barren.

lines.value: SIR TOBY BELCH
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: O knight thou lackest a cup of canary: when did I
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: see thee so put down?
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: SIR ANDREW
lines.speaker: SIR ANDREW

lines.value: Never in your life, I think; unless you see canary
lines.speaker: SIR ANDREW

lines.value: put me down. Methinks sometimes I have no more wit
lines.speaker: SIR ANDREW

lines.value: than a Christian or an ordinary man has: but I am a

lines.value: great eater of beef and I believe that does harm to my wit.
lines.speaker: SIR ANDREW

lines.value: SIR TOBY BELCH
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: No question.
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: SIR ANDREW
lines.speaker: SIR ANDREW

lines.value: An I thought that, I'ld forswear it. I'll ride home
lines.speaker: SIR ANDREW

lines.value: to-morrow, Sir Toby.
lines.speaker: SIR ANDREW

lines.value: SIR TOBY BELCH
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: Pourquoi, my dear knight?
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: SIR ANDREW
lines.speaker: SIR ANDREW

lines.value: What is 'Pourquoi'? do or not do? I would I had
lines.speaker: SIR ANDREW

lines.value: bestowed that time in the tongues that I have in
lines.speaker: SIR ANDREW

lines.value: fencing, dancing and bear-baiting: O, had I but
lines.speaker: SIR ANDREW

lines.value: followed the arts!
lines.speaker: SIR ANDREW

lines.value: SIR TOBY BELCH
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: Then hadst thou had an excellent head of hair.
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: SIR ANDREW
lines.speaker: SIR ANDREW

lines.value: Why, would that have mended my hair?
lines.speaker: SIR ANDREW

lines.value: SIR TOBY BELCH
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: Past question; for thou seest it will not curl by nature.
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: SIR ANDREW
lines.speaker: SIR ANDREW

lines.value: But it becomes me well enough, does't not?

lines.value: SIR TOBY BELCH
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: Excellent; it hangs like flax on a distaff; and I
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: hope to see a housewife take thee between her legs
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: and spin it off.

lines.value: SIR ANDREW
lines.speaker: SIR ANDREW

lines.value: Faith, I'll home to-morrow, Sir Toby: your niece
lines.speaker: SIR ANDREW

lines.value: will not be seen; or if she be, it's four to one

lines.value: SIR TOBY BELCH
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: her degree, neither in estate, years, nor wit; I

lines.value: man.
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: SIR ANDREW
lines.speaker: SIR ANDREW

lines.value: I'll stay a month longer. I am a fellow o' the

lines.value: strangest mind i' the world; I delight in masques

lines.value: SIR TOBY BELCH
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: SIR ANDREW
lines.speaker: SIR ANDREW

lines.value: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: SIR ANDREW

lines.value: SIR TOBY BELCH
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: SIR ANDREW
lines.speaker: SIR ANDREW

lines.value: And I think I have the back-trick simply as strong

lines.value: as any man in Illyria.

lines.value: SIR TOBY BELCH
lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH

lines.value: so much as make water but in a sink-a-pace. What

lines.value: OLIVIA
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: OLIVIA

lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: VIOLA
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.value: [To OLIVIA]  So comes it, lady, you have been mistook:
lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.value: But nature to her bias drew in that.
lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.value: You would have been contracted to a maid;
lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.value: Nor are you therein, by my life, deceived,
lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.value: You are betroth'd both to a maid and man.
lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.value: DUKE ORSINO
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: Be not amazed; right noble is his blood.
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: If this be so, as yet the glass seems true,
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: I shall have share in this most happy wreck.
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: Boy, thou hast said to me a thousand times
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: Thou never shouldst love woman like to me.
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: VIOLA
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: And all those sayings will I overswear;
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: And those swearings keep as true in soul
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: As doth that orbed continent the fire
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: That severs day from night.
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: DUKE ORSINO
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: Give me thy hand;
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: And let me see thee in thy woman's weeds.
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: VIOLA
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: The captain that did bring me first on shore
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: Hath my maid's garments: he upon some action
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: Is now in durance, at Malvolio's suit,
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: A gentleman, and follower of my lady's.
lines.speaker: VIOLA

lines.value: OLIVIA
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: He shall enlarge him: fetch Malvolio hither:
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: And yet, alas, now I remember me,
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: They say, poor gentleman, he's much distract.
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: A most extracting frenzy of mine own
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: From my remembrance clearly banish'd his.
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: How does he, sirrah?
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: Clown
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: Truly, madam, he holds Belzebub at the staves's end as
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: well as a man in his case may do: has here writ a
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: letter to you; I should have given't you to-day
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: morning, but as a madman's epistles are no gospels,
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: so it skills not much when they are delivered.
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: OLIVIA
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: Open't, and read it.
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: Clown
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: Look then to be well edified when the fool delivers
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: the madman.
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: 'By the Lord, madam,'--
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: OLIVIA
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: How now! art thou mad?
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: Clown
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: No, madam, I do but read madness: an your ladyship
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: will have it as it ought to be, you must allow Vox.
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: OLIVIA
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: Prithee, read i' thy right wits.
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: Clown
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: So I do, madonna; but to read his right wits is to
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: read thus: therefore perpend, my princess, and give ear.
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: OLIVIA
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: Read it you, sirrah.
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: FABIAN
lines.speaker: FABIAN

lines.value: [Reads]  'By the Lord, madam, you wrong me, and the
lines.speaker: FABIAN

lines.value: world shall know it: though you have put me into
lines.speaker: FABIAN

lines.value: darkness and given your drunken cousin rule over
lines.speaker: FABIAN

lines.value: me, yet have I the benefit of my senses as well as
lines.speaker: FABIAN

lines.value: your ladyship. I have your own letter that induced
lines.speaker: FABIAN

lines.value: me to the semblance I put on; with the which I doubt
lines.speaker: FABIAN

lines.value: not but to do myself much right, or you much shame.
lines.speaker: FABIAN

lines.value: Think of me as you please. I leave my duty a little
lines.speaker: FABIAN

lines.value: unthought of and speak out of my injury.
lines.speaker: FABIAN

lines.value: THE MADLY-USED MALVOLIO.'
lines.speaker: FABIAN

lines.value: OLIVIA
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: Did he write this?
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: Clown
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: Ay, madam.
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: DUKE ORSINO
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: This savours not much of distraction.
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: OLIVIA
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: See him deliver'd, Fabian; bring him hither.
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: My lord so please you, these things further
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: thought on,
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: To think me as well a sister as a wife,
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: One day shall crown the alliance on't, so please you,
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: Here at my house and at my proper cost.
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: DUKE ORSINO
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: Madam, I am most apt to embrace your offer.
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: Your master quits you; and for your service done him,
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: So much against the mettle of your sex,
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: So far beneath your soft and tender breeding,
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: And since you call'd me master for so long,
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: Here is my hand: you shall from this time be
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: Your master's mistress.
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: OLIVIA
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: A sister! you are she.
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: DUKE ORSINO
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: Is this the madman?
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: OLIVIA
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: Ay, my lord, this same.
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: How now, Malvolio!
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: MALVOLIO
lines.speaker: MALVOLIO

lines.value: Madam, you have done me wrong,
lines.speaker: MALVOLIO

lines.value: Notorious wrong.
lines.speaker: MALVOLIO

lines.value: OLIVIA
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: Have I, Malvolio? no.
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: MALVOLIO
lines.speaker: MALVOLIO

lines.value: Lady, you have. Pray you, peruse that letter.
lines.speaker: MALVOLIO

lines.value: You must not now deny it is your hand:
lines.speaker: MALVOLIO

lines.value: Write from it, if you can, in hand or phrase;
lines.speaker: MALVOLIO

lines.value: Or say 'tis not your seal, nor your invention:
lines.speaker: MALVOLIO

lines.value: You can say none of this: well, grant it then
lines.speaker: MALVOLIO

lines.value: And tell me, in the modesty of honour,
lines.speaker: MALVOLIO

lines.value: Why you have given me such clear lights of favour,
lines.speaker: MALVOLIO

lines.value: Bade me come smiling and cross-garter'd to you,
lines.speaker: MALVOLIO

lines.value: To put on yellow stockings and to frown
lines.speaker: MALVOLIO

lines.value: Upon Sir Toby and the lighter people;
lines.speaker: MALVOLIO

lines.value: And, acting this in an obedient hope,
lines.speaker: MALVOLIO

lines.value: Why have you suffer'd me to be imprison'd,
lines.speaker: MALVOLIO

lines.value: Kept in a dark house, visited by the priest,
lines.speaker: MALVOLIO

lines.value: And made the most notorious geck and gull
lines.speaker: MALVOLIO

lines.value: That e'er invention play'd on? tell me why.
lines.speaker: MALVOLIO

lines.value: OLIVIA
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: Alas, Malvolio, this is not my writing,
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: Though, I confess, much like the character
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: But out of question 'tis Maria's hand.
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: And now I do bethink me, it was she
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: First told me thou wast mad; then camest in smiling,
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: And in such forms which here were presupposed
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: Upon thee in the letter. Prithee, be content:
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: This practise hath most shrewdly pass'd upon thee;
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: But when we know the grounds and authors of it,
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: Thou shalt be both the plaintiff and the judge
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: Of thine own cause.
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: FABIAN
lines.speaker: FABIAN

lines.value: Good madam, hear me speak,
lines.speaker: FABIAN

lines.value: And let no quarrel nor no brawl to come
lines.speaker: FABIAN

lines.value: Taint the condition of this present hour,
lines.speaker: FABIAN

lines.value: Which I have wonder'd at. In hope it shall not,
lines.speaker: FABIAN

lines.value: Most freely I confess, myself and Toby
lines.speaker: FABIAN

lines.value: Set this device against Malvolio here,
lines.speaker: FABIAN

lines.value: Upon some stubborn and uncourteous parts
lines.speaker: FABIAN

lines.value: We had conceived against him: Maria writ
lines.speaker: FABIAN

lines.value: The letter at Sir Toby's great importance;
lines.speaker: FABIAN

lines.value: In recompense whereof he hath married her.
lines.speaker: FABIAN

lines.value: How with a sportful malice it was follow'd,
lines.speaker: FABIAN

lines.value: May rather pluck on laughter than revenge;
lines.speaker: FABIAN

lines.value: If that the injuries be justly weigh'd
lines.speaker: FABIAN

lines.value: That have on both sides pass'd.
lines.speaker: FABIAN

lines.value: OLIVIA
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: Alas, poor fool, how have they baffled thee!
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: Clown
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: Why, 'some are born great, some achieve greatness,
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: and some have greatness thrown upon them.' I was
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: one, sir, in this interlude; one Sir Topas, sir; but
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: that's all one. 'By the Lord, fool, I am not mad.'
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: But do you remember? 'Madam, why laugh you at such
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: a barren rascal? an you smile not, he's gagged:'
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: and thus the whirligig of time brings in his revenges.
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: MALVOLIO
lines.speaker: MALVOLIO

lines.value: I'll be revenged on the whole pack of you.
lines.speaker: MALVOLIO

lines.value: OLIVIA
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: He hath been most notoriously abused.
lines.speaker: OLIVIA

lines.value: DUKE ORSINO
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: Pursue him and entreat him to a peace:
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: He hath not told us of the captain yet:
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: When that is known and golden time convents,
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: A solemn combination shall be made
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: Of our dear souls. Meantime, sweet sister,
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: We will not part from hence. Cesario, come;
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: For so you shall be, while you are a man;
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: But when in other habits you are seen,
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: Orsino's mistress and his fancy's queen.
lines.speaker: DUKE ORSINO

lines.value: Clown
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: [Sings]
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: When that I was and a little tiny boy,
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: With hey, ho, the wind and the rain,
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: A foolish thing was but a toy,
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: For the rain it raineth every day.
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: But when I came to man's estate,
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: With hey, ho,  & c.
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: 'Gainst knaves and thieves men shut their gate,
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: For the rain,  & c.
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: But when I came, alas! to wive,
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: With hey, ho,  & c.
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: By swaggering could I never thrive,
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: For the rain,  & c.
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: But when I came unto my beds,
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: With hey, ho,  & c.
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: With toss-pots still had drunken heads,
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: For the rain,  & c.
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: A great while ago the world begun,
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: With hey, ho,  & c.
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: But that's all one, our play is done,
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: And we'll strive to please you every day.
lines.speaker: Clown
